name: Write dialogue between two fantasy characters
description: Write dialogue beteween two fantasy characters for nearly any situation.
prompt:
Write dialogue between two characters. (Change any of the details below, keeping the genre fantasy)
Genre: Fantasy
Dialogue Type: [Enter type, IE hostile, friendly, etc.]
Character names: [first character, second character]
[character 1] personality: [personality trait]
[character 2] personality: [personality traits]
Situation: [situation]
PEX:
Write dialogue between two characters.
Genre: Fantasy
Dialogue Type: Heated argument
Character names: Bobo Underhill, The Wizard Tor
Bobo's personality: Shy, broken, afraid
Tor's personality: Headstrong, aloof, impulsive
Situation: They are deciding their next move, trying to avoid getting caught by the orcs hunting them.

"I don't know about that..." Said Bobo. "We are already moving in dangerous territory, I say we stick to the forest and only move at night."

"Bobo, no. We are wasting time, dammit! We must return the Sword of Avalon to the capitol by nightfall in three days, otherwise we will lose our ability to strike back against the horde." Tor clinched his fist. He knew time was short.

"Yes but that risks us getting caught. I think we need to move..."

"Listen, I will take the sword myself, you can meet me in the capitol if you want to take that path." Tor said, interrupting Bobo.

"Okay! Fine, have it your way. But I'm going with you Tor." He immediately backed off his forest path idea. There was no way Bobo was traveling alone.

"I'm glad you've come to your senses," Tor said. "Let's get moving."

##
